result.reason: UriBuilder.Host lowercases hostnames; Quick Connect should preserve user-typed case for servers with uppercase DNS/NetBIOS names
result.approach: In CreateQuickConnect(), use the original connectionString directly for Hostname and Name instead of uriBuilder.Host, since port parsing is already done manually before uriBuilder assignment

attempts.raw_output:
Now I understand the issue. The `UriBuilder.Host` property at line 89 of `ConnectionsService.cs` automatically lowercases the hostname per RFC 3986. When users type "MYSERVER" in Quick Connect, it becomes "myserver".

```json
{"decision":"implement","reason":"UriBuilder.Host lowercases hostnames; Quick Connect should preserve user-typed case for servers with uppercase DNS/NetBIOS names","priority":"P3-enhancement","estimated_files":["mRemoteNG/Connection/ConnectionsService.cs"],"approach":"In CreateQuickConnect(), use the original connectionString directly for Hostname and Name instead of uriBuilder.Host, since port parsing is already done manually before uriBuilder assignment"}
```
